subject_terms_3: visual arts  Artistic photography Potrait photography
materials_name: gelatin  paper (fibre product)  silver sulfide  baryta paper
object_work_type: black-and-white prints (photographs) gelatin silver prints  photographic prints
physical_appearance: This print captures a man docking a sampan and securing its oars. He dons a sarong bottom and has his head wrapped in a head scarf. There is yellowing along the perimeter of the print, and the backing on which it is mounted has brown spotting. On the bottom right corner of the print, an RPS Associate 1957 is embossed and on the verso, the photographer studio's chop and title of the work can be found.
sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. This photograph was part of a set of 12 prints sent to the Royal Photographic Society in 1956.
subject_terms_2: Portrait photography  Photography, Artistic  Docks Wooden boats Headgear
techniques_name: gelatin silver process photographic printing techniques black-and-white photography
